intro: Isoschoenus acuminatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically pale green to brown, and it is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Isoschoenus acuminatus is adapted to arid environments and is used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
